instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: 820 - 00840 - a not charging (?) after liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi

Some liquid damage to the board, cleaned up, new battery, new 821-00614-a flex cable.
Unit asks to be plugged in, when plugged in shows its charging but never goes beyond that.
Any pointers?

Thank you in advance

threads.title: 820 - 00840 - a not charging (?) after liquid damage
threads.message:
So you can boot into OSX with charger connected?
Do you get amber light on Magsafe?
Describe liquid affected areas...

threads.title: 820 - 00840 - a not charging (?) after liquid damage
threads.message:
no boot - with charger I can only get the battery icon in the middle of the screen, without the charger I get the icon asking to plug it in

I have this usb c charger - idk if there is any led indicator on it

Liquid damage around <CHIP>U7220</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q8030</TRANSISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8192</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8192</CAPACITOR> and L7030, not much - little battery board was affected the most

threads.title: 820 - 00840 - a not charging (?) after liquid damage
threads.message:
Battery must be changed, if its circuitry has been affected by liquid.
But you should get the board working on charger only, without issue.

Check <RESISTOR>R7071</RESISTOR> and post <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 820 - 00840 - a not charging (?) after liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi

<RESISTOR>R7071</RESISTOR> is fine
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is 3.37v

I have a new battery
I get fan spin and with battery connected or disconnected it shows charging on the screen - I guess thats not right

threads.title: 820 - 00840 - a not charging (?) after liquid damage
threads.message:
You should reball SMC.
Also check for other corroded components and/or traces.
